ud2.10:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Anupiya in a mango grove.
ud2.10:1.3: Now at that time, Venerable Bhaddiya the son of Kāḷīgodhā, even in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, frequently expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud2.10:2.4: “Without a doubt, Venerable Bhaddiya lives the spiritual life dissatisfied. It’s when recalling the pleasures of royalty he formerly enjoyed as a lay person that, even in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, he frequently expresses this heartfelt sentiment:
ud2.10:3.1: Then those mendicants went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side,
ud2.10:3.2: and told him what was happening.
ud2.10:4.1: The Buddha addressed one of those mendicants,
